cRefPattern.p: This pattern references a specific line.
This pattern references an inscribed surface.
This pattern references a specific artefact, usually a tablet.

div.l: [lugal]-⸢gu10⸣-ra u3-na-⸢a⸣-[du11]
⸢maš2⸣ hur-sag-ga2 a2 sa6-sa6-[...]
sisix(|ANŠE.KUR|) hur-sag-ga2 umbin u11-ri2-in-x-[...]
{geš}gešimmar ki sikil-e mu2-a zu2-lum za-gin3 ⸢la2⸣-[...]
u3-ne-de3-tah
{diš}a-ba-nam-da-sa2 ugula aga-us2 zu2-keš2
sag-⸢ki⸣ zalag lugal-la-na-⸢ta⸣
ša3 lugal-la-na du10-du10-ge-ra
ARAD-zu na-ab-be2-a
kal-ga me-en aga-us2-zu he2-me-en
⸢ma2⸣ gub-ba {geš}gisal mu-un-si-ge
[...] še mu-un-si-ge
[...] x-⸢ga2⸣ mu-un-zalag-ge
[...] x x im-ma-ak-en
[...]-ga2 ⸢mu⸣-⸢un⸣-du3-u3-nam mu-⸢dur7⸣-re im-gurum-e
[...]-⸢ga2⸣ ⸢lu2⸣ ⸢mu⸣-⸢un⸣-da-la2-a šu-gu10 eš2 im-ma-an-la2
[...] ⸢tug2⸣ dan6#?-na mi#?-ni-mur10-ra [tug2] mu-dur7-ra ba-an-mur10
lag-e a mi-ni-in-tu5-x#? sahar igi-ga2 ba-e-gub
ur-re adda ib2-gu7 gaba-bi ib2-zix(GAB)-zix(GAB)
ušumgal-e sag geš ib2-ra-ra ka da13-da13 ib2-tak4
geš-gi izi ub-gu7-a a-nigin2 i3-da13-da13
{d}utu i3 un-gu7 gar9 un-gu7 {geš}banšur ukur3-ra-še3 šu-ni ib2-ši-in-tum3
ga2-e me-en-na-a ša3 {d}šul-gi lugal-gu10 ki-bi ha-ma-gi4-gi4
After you speak to my king
To my buck of the mountain range with beautiful horns
Horse of the mountain range with claws of an eagle
My date palm grown in a pure place from which shining dates hang down from
After you repeat to him
For(!?) Abaindasa, the overseer of the arrayed troops
He who by delighting his king
Pleases the heart of his king
Your servant, thus says
I am powerful, and therefore am your soldier
(When) the boat is idle, (I) prepare the oars
(When) the wind is still, (I) prepare(?) the grain
(When) ..., (I) illuminate ...
(When) the water is still, I make it flow
(But now, as if) I was planted like a tree in my forest, (I) bend over as one who is dirty(?)
The one who could tie (me) in my chair(?) has bound my hands with rope
In my city, I, the one who wore a clean garment, (now) wears a dirty garment
As one who has washed with mud clods, I caked(?) dirt on my face
A dog that has eaten carrion has (also) retreated
An ušumgal creature that kills has (also) left behind scraps(?)
After the reedbed is consumed by fire, the ponds remain
After Utu has eaten butter and cream, he touches(?) the table/platter of the poor person
As for me, when will the heart of Shulgi my king be returned to its place on my behalf?
